enb_long_title: Twenty-sixth sessions of the Subsidiary Bodies (SB 26) of the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC)
sentences: In its conclusions ( FCCC/SBSTA/2007/L.4 ), the SBSTA agrees to develop and maintain the dialogue between parties and regional and international climate change research programmes and organizations.
It agrees that the SBSTA's role should be facilitative and not prescriptive.
It notes the importance of the dialogue to identify research gaps and research capacity constraints in developing countries and to consider possible opportunities to address these gaps.

It invites relevant research programmes to regularly inform SBSTA of developments in various relevant research activities, and asks the Secretariat to invite these groups to consider these issues in an informal discussion at SBSTA 28.
